The accused also convinced the woman to increase her debit card limit that helped them withdraw ₹5.35 lakh from her account till Wednesday noon, a police official said.

175.title: Court acquits Mumbai man in rash driving case due to poor road condition
175.article_body: A 61-year-old man in Mumbai was acquitted in a rash driving case after the court noted that it appears it wasn't the accused's fault as the road at the accident site was dug up. The court noted that it's not sufficient to prove the accident took place by accused's vehicle. The victim had suffered a broken leg and ankle.

176.title: Pet pitbull dog attacks, seriously injures 35-yr-old house help in Gurugram
176.article_body: A pet pitbull dog allegedly attacked and seriously injured a 35-year-old house help who was on her way to work in Gurugram's Civil Lines area on Thursday morning. A police officer, requesting anonymity, said preliminary probe has found that the dog attacked her from behind and bit into her neck. The dog let her go after intervention from a passerby.

177.title: Australia cricketers donate tour prize money to children, families in crisis-hit SL
177.article_body: Australian men's cricket team players donated their prize money from the recent all-format tour of Sri Lanka to support children and families impacted by Sri Lanka's economic crisis. In all, the team donated AU$45,000 to UNICEF Australia's Sri Lanka appeal. "It was very clear to us how much day-to-day life for Sri Lankans is being impacted," Pat Cummins said.

178.title: Satellite photographs indicate serious damage to Crimea air base
178.article_body: Commercially available satellite photographs taken before and after purported explosions in Crimea's Saki air base earlier this week show heavy damage sustained by the station. Earlier, Russia, which controls Crimea, denied any attack in the peninsula and rubbished reports of any damage to its aircraft. Ukraine has claimed nine Russian aircraft were destroyed in Crimea.

179.title: Mohali Police arrest 2 for extorting businessmen in the district
179.article_body: Mohali Police have arrested two people who were involved in extorting businessmen in the district. The accused were members of a gang and were already wanted for firing outside a nightclub in March. According to Mohali Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) Vivek Sheel Soni, the arrested would scare businessmen by firing outside their homes or offices to get money extorted.

180.title: Sitabuldi Fort to open as part of Independence Day celebrations
180.article_body: The Indian Army will open the Sitabuldi Fort as part of the 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav' to commemorate 75 years of India's independence. A symbol of military heritage, the fort is controlled by the Indian Army. It is only opened to the general public on specific days and this year, as an exception, will be open for two days.

181.title: British Instagrammer asked to leave Sri Lanka after she backed protesters
181.article_body: A British woman Instagrammer who was in Sri Lanka has been asked by authorities to leave the country before August 15 for participating in anti-government protests. Officials seized Kayleigh Fraser's passport to check if she had violated any of the visa conditions while staying in the crisis-hit country. Fraser had posted images and videos of the recent 'GotaGoHome' protest campaign.

182.title: BJP will be uprooted in 2024, will lose 40 LS seats in 3 states: JD(U)
182.article_body: Janata Dal (United) National President Lalan Singh on Thursday stated that BJP will be uprooted from power at the Centre in 2024. He added that BJP will lose 40 Lok Sabha seats out of its 2019 winning tally in three states — Bihar, Jharkhand and West Bengal. Singh made the remarks after meeting RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav.

183.title: Nykaa's CEO of private label division Reena Chhabra quits
183.article_body: In a regulatory filing, Nykaa said that the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of its private label division FSN Brands, Reena Chhabra, has resigned, with effect from August 16. Earlier, she worked with cosmetic brand Colorbar as their COO and joined Nykaa in 2016. According to the draft red herring prospectus, she was paid a total of ₹3.06 crore in FY21.

184.title: BankBazaar.com to raise $100 mn in 3 years: CEO Adhil Shetty
184.article_body: BankBazaar.com is looking to raise $100 million in the next three years to aid the company's accelerating business practices, Founder and CEO Adhil Shetty said. The company expects to grow 80-90% in FY23, he added. Shetty said that the fintech firm achieved breakeven on a month-on-month basis in March 2022, and that they are currently not looking for immediate capital.

185.title: Pant honoured by Uttarakhand CM, months after being appointed state brand ambassador
185.article_body: Cricketer Rishabh Pant was on Thursday honoured by Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami in a programme organised at Uttarakhand Sadan in New Delhi, months after being appointed as the brand ambassador of the state. "It's no doubt a great feeling and also a huge responsibility," Pant wrote while sharing a picture on Instagram. Pant was born in Uttarakhand's Haridwar.

186.title: People chant 'chor-chor' as TMC leader Mondal is produced before court
186.article_body: Unidentified people chanted "chor-chor" (thief-thief) outside a CBI court in West Bengal's Asansol when Trinamool Congress (TMC) Birbhum district president Anubrata Mondal arrived there for a hearing on Thursday. People also showed black flags and shoes at his arrival. Mondal was arrested on Thursday in a cattle smuggling scam case. The CBI court has sent him to a 10-day custody.

187.title: Indian fintech startups to have $1 trillion assets by 2030: Report
187.article_body: Indian financial technology startups will have $1 trillion assets under management (AUM) and $200 billion revenue by 2030, a report by venture capital firm Chiratae Ventures and EY India said. The report added that fintechs' AUM in 2021 was around $100 billion and revenue around $20 billion. The digital lending market is expected to grow to $515 billion by 2030.

188.title: Tripura receives ₹50 cr to upgrade sports infrastructure in state
188.article_body: Tripura Sports Minister Sushanta Chowdhury announced that the state and central governments have sanctioned ₹50 crore to upgrade sports infrastructure in the state. "We want to develop sports infrastructure to ensure more good players come up. Also, sports will ensure youths don't take the path of drugs," he said. The government also decided to induct 100 new junior physical instructors.

189.title: Latvian Parliament declares Russia a 'state sponsor of terrorism'
189.article_body: The Latvian Parliament has declared Russia a “state sponsor of terrorism” for allegedly attacking civilians in its invasion of Ukraine. A strongly worded statement adopted by lawmakers in Riga said Moscow was using “suffering and intimidation as tools in its attempts to demoralise the Ukrainian people". In the 100-seat assembly, 67 lawmakers voted in favour of adopting the statement.

190.title: His condition has neither improved nor worsened: Raju Srivastava's daughter
190.article_body: Comedian Raju Srivastava continues to remain in the Intensive Care Unit of AIIMS after suffering from a heart attack. His daughter Antara, while sharing an update about his health, told Times of India, "His condition has neither improved nor worsened. The entire medical team is doing their best." "We are praying and hoping he will be fine soon," she added.

191.title: Speculation of my exit only strengthens my position: Bommai
191.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said that speculations about his replacement will only strengthen his position. Calling the rumours politically motivated, Bommai said, "I have come to accept the situation. I know the truth. I know that there is no basis for this speculation." Bommai's remarks come amid Congress party's social media messages stating that the BJP will replace him.

192.title: Spain evacuates another 294 Afghan refugees
192.article_body: The Spanish government has evacuated another 294 refugees from Afghanistan to the country, via Pakistan, officials said on Thursday. Since August last year, Spain has evacuated to Madrid 3,900 people from the war-torn nation. The evacuated persons include people who had worked for the Spanish government or its troops stationed in Afghanistan before the Taliban took over.

193.title: Do you think I have become old: Babar Azam to reporter asking if he should quit 1 format
193.article_body: After a reporter asked him if he should quit one format due to workload, Pakistan captain Babar Azam replied, "Do you think I have become old?" Babar added, "The kind of fitness that we have, I don't think we should limit ourselves to two formats." He further said, "If workload is high then we will increase our fitness levels."

194.title: MI Cape Town announce their first group of players for upcoming T20 league
194.article_body: MI Cape Town today announced the signing of five players ahead of the inaugural edition of Cricket South Africa T20 League. The players include Kagiso Rabada, Dewald Brevis, Rashid Khan, Sam Curran and Liam Livingstone. The players have been signed ahead of the auctions as per the rules that govern the T20 league, MI said.

195.title: Truck full of migrants overturns in North Macedonia; 35 injured
195.article_body: A truck carrying 49 Syrian migrants overturned on a road in North Macedonia, causing injuries to 35 people, police said on Thursday. The migrants are believed to have entered North Macedonia from neighbouring Greece. The truck driver escaped on foot from the accident scene on Wednesday and is suspected to be part of a migrant smuggling ring.

196.title: Was like hearing KK: Leslee Lewis on recording 'Yaaron' with KK's son
196.article_body: Music composer Leslee Lewis opened up on his experience of re-recording 'Yaaron Dosti' song with late singer KK's son Nakul and daughter Tamara. He said recording with Nakul was "unbelievable". "It was like I was hearing KK," he shared. The original version of the song, sung by KK, was recorded 23 years ago.

197.title: Shehbaz is very protective of me: Shehnaaz Gill
197.article_body: Bigg Boss 13 fame Shehnaaz Gill opened up about her relationship with brother Shehbaz. She said, "Shehbaz is very protective of me. Every brother-sister should be that for each other." Crediting Shehnaaz for his success, Shehbaz said he is 'very lucky' to have her in life. On the work front, Shehnaaz is set to make her Bollywood debut.

198.title: Congress MLA Sudip attacked in Tripura, hospitalised; party blames BJP
198.article_body: Congress MLA Sudip Roy Barman sustained head injuries on Thursday after being attacked by unidentified people during 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in Agartala, Tripura. He's undergoing treatment at hospital. Tripura Congress blamed "BJP goons" for the attack on Sudip and other leaders. Congress' Birajit Singh said miscreants had thrown stones at Sudip's car. Other Congress members were also injured.

199.title: Scriptures like Manusmriti give respectable position to women: HC Judge
199.article_body: Delhi High Court judge Justice Prathiba M Singh has said that the Indian women "are a blessed lot" since scriptures like Manusmriti give a very respectable position to them. She added that India is more progressive about women being in leadership roles. Women are respected in Asian countries because of the cultural and religious background of scriptures, she further said.

200.title: 160 grams of heroin seized in Haryana's Ambala, 2 arrested
200.article_body: The police on Thursday arrested two men, Arvind and Vijay, with 160 grams of heroin from a village near Ambala cantonment in Haryana, officials said. Acting on a tip off, a police team stopped a car at a check post on Ambala-Delhi highway, they added. During the search, police recovered the drugs from two men, both residents of Ambala Cantonment.

201.title: 'Dream Girl 2' to star Ananya, Paresh Rawal, Seema Pahwa: Reports
201.article_body: The makers of 'Dream Girl 2' have reportedly shortlisted the cast of the film. As per a report, Ananya Panday, Paresh Rawal and Seema Pahwa will be joining Ayushmann Khurrana, who will be reprising his role. 'Dream Girl 2' is the sequel of 2019 film with the same name. It was directed by Raaj Shaandilyaa.

202.title: Shashi Tharoor to be conferred France's highest civilian award
202.article_body: Senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor is set to be conferred with France's highest civilian award Chevalier de la Legion d'Honneur for his writings and speeches. French Ambassador to India Emmanuel Lenain wrote to Tharoor, informing him about the award. "I am honoured to be recognised in this way. My gratitude and appreciation," Tharoor said.

203.title: Dozens missing as migrant boat sinks off Greece's coast
203.article_body: A Greek navy vessel and three merchant ships were on a search and rescue operation on Thursday after a boat carrying migrants sank off the southeastern coast of Greece on Wednesday, officials said. Only 29 men from Afghanistan, Iran and Iraq have been rescued till now. Survivors told officials that 60 to 80 people were onboard the boat.

204.title: Cameroon troops killed 10 people in crackdown on separatists: NGO
204.article_body: Cameroonian troops "summarily killed" at least 10 people during President Paul Biya's crackdown on Anglophone separatists earlier in the year, a report by Human Rights Watch said on Thursday. "The troops also burned 12 homes, destroyed, and looted health facilities," the report stated. The report comes as fighting between security forces and militants have intensified recently.

205.title: Woman spends ₹48 lakh to look like Kim Kardashian in South Korea, pics surface
205.article_body: Cherrie Lee, 28, from South Korea has undergone 15 surgeries in eight years to look like Kim Kardashian. "Whenever I have to explain to someone that I'm Korean and they [say]...I don't look [like] it, I feel unique and exotic," she stated. She has spent £50,000 (over ₹48 lakh) on procedures including Brazilian butt lifts, breast augmentations and facial surgeries.

206.title: Centre waives off taxes for rich, but imposes it on poor: Kejriwal
206.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP national convener Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday attacked the Centre and said the Centre provides tax waivers for the rich, but overburdens the poor with taxes. "What was the condition of the central government that it was time to impose tax on the poorest of the poor?" Kejriwal questioned. Kejriwal further criticised the Centre's Agnipath scheme.

207.title: Nobody can force anyone to buy the national flag: Haryana CM
207.article_body: Amid reports that a Karnal ration depot compelled people to buy the tricolour, Haryana CM Manohar Khattar on Thursday clarified that nobody can force anyone to buy the flag. "No person will be denied...services even if he doesn't wish to buy the national flag. Under 'Har Ghar Tiranga Abhiyan', people can voluntarily buy the flag," CM said in a statement.

208.title: People took my self-confidence for arrogance: KGF actor Yash
208.article_body: Kannada actor Yash said his self-confidence made him what he is today. However, he said a few years ago, his self-confidence was mistaken for arrogance. "When I spoke with self-confidence like this a few years ago, some may have thought I was arrogant," he said. The 'KGF' star added that his belief in himself has brought respect to Kannada cinema.

209.title: 51-yr-old Norwegian woman staying illegally in India held in Manipur
209.article_body: A 51-year-old Norwegian woman has been arrested in the border town of Moreh in Manipur for illegally staying in India, the Assam Rifles said on Thursday. Mya Kyay Mon, who arrived in India in 2020, was intercepted at the foreigners' checkpost in Khudengthabi while she was travelling to Kolkata, it said. Her passport and visa had expired, it added.

210.title: He asked me to send girls to his bungalow every night: Hostel warden on MP SDM
210.article_body: A former warden of a government-run girls hostel in Madhya Pradesh's Shivpuri district alleged that the then-district coordinator Bijender Singh Yadav, who's currently an SDM, used to ask her to "send girls to his bungalow" every night. She added he used to threaten her with transfer in case his demands weren't met. An inquiry has been launched into the matter.

211.title: Woman spends ₹48 lakh to look like Kim Kardashian, says 'People don't believe I'm Korean'
211.article_body: Cherrie Lee, 28, from South Korea has undergone 15 surgeries in eight years to look like Kim Kardashian. "Whenever I have to explain to someone that I'm Korean and they [say]...I don't look [like] it, I feel unique and exotic," she stated. She has spent £50,000 (over ₹48 lakh) on procedures including Brazilian butt lifts, breast augmentations and facial surgeries.

212.title: Kejriwal has given 'perverse twist' to freebies debate: Sitharaman
212.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Thursday took a jibe at Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, saying he had given a "perverse twist" to the debate on freebies as health and education were never considered giveaways. Sitharaman said that by classifying education and health as freebies, Kejriwal was trying to instil fear in the minds of the poor.

213.title: 4 killed, several missing as boat capsizes in UP's Banda due to strong winds
213.article_body: At least four people were killed and several went missing after a boat carrying around 35 people capsized in the Yamuna river in Uttar Pradesh's Banda. The boat capsized due to strong winds, the Superintendent of Police said. As per local residents, many of them were going to celebrate Raksha Bandhan with their siblings.

214.title: Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict moves SC for premature release
214.article_body: Nalini Sriharan, a life convict in former PM Rajiv Gandhi's assassination case, moved the Supreme Court on Thursday seeking premature release. She cited the court's judgement in the case where co-convict AG Perarivalan was released from prison. "Tamil Nadu [Council] had recommended [the] Governor to release the…convicts in 2018. But…the Governor sent the issue to the President," her lawyer said.

215.title: Self-driving Tesla Model 3 runs down child dummy in multiple safety tests
215.article_body: The Dawn Project CEO Dan O'Dowd has posted a video of a Tesla Model 3 equipped with Full Self-Driving (FSD) software running down a child mannequin placed in its path during safety tests. O'Dowd claimed there wasn't any interference or input from the test driver. He demanded a ban on FSD software until Tesla "proves it won't mow down children".

216.title: KL Rahul to lead India in 3-match ODI series against Zimbabwe, Dhawan named his deputy
216.article_body: Batter KL Rahul has been declared fit for the three-match ODI series against Zimbabwe, the BCCI said. Rahul will be leading the squad in the series, while Shikhar Dhawan, who was initially named captain, has now been named Rahul's deputy. The ODI series will begin on August 18, while the last ODI will take place on August 22.

217.title: Armed man takes Beirut bank staff hostage, demands his trapped savings
217.article_body: A Lebanese man armed with a shotgun has taken hostages at a Beirut bank and threatened to set himself on fire unless he receives his trapped savings to pay his father's medical bills. Soldiers and police converged on the area and sought a negotiation. Lebanon's cash-strapped banks since 2019 have put strict limits on withdrawals of foreign currency assets.

218.title: In veiled attack at Nitish, Minister shares clip showing dog fighting 2 lions
218.article_body: Union Minister Giriraj Singh, on Thursday, tweeted a video showing a dog trying to fight two lions and captioned it "Challenge 2024", which he later deleted. The video came a day after Bihar CM Nitish Kumar asserted that the NDA government needs to worry about the 2024 LS polls. "The RJD's plan to loot Bihar has begun," Singh said.

219.title: Pics of Kobe's remains after crash shared by police, firefighters for a laugh, court told
219.article_body: The pictures of Kobe Bryant's remains after the helicopter crash were shared by LA County police and firefighters "for a laugh", Kobe's wife Vanessa's attorney Luis Li told a court during Vanessa's invasion of privacy trial against the county. "They were shared by deputies playing video games...They were shared...with people who had absolutely no reason to receive them," he added.

220.title: TMC has become a party of thieves: WB Cong chief Adhir Chowdhury
220.article_body: After TMC's Anubrata Mondal was arrested by CBI in connection with the cattle smuggling scam, West Bengal Congress chief Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said TMC has become a party of thieves. "CM Mamata Banerjee and TMC leaders are involved in scams," Chowdhury said. "Such scams are not possible without the support of government and the police," he added.

221.title: 27-year-old American tourist raped in public toilet in Paris
221.article_body: An American woman was allegedly raped in a public toilet in Paris on Saturday. The 27-year-old was walking with her boyfriend along the River Seine across Notre Dame Cathedral when she stopped to use a public bathroom at around 1 am. The suspect, a 23-year-old man, was charged with rape and kept in custody.

222.title: Self-proclaimed politician Shrikant Tyagi's bail plea rejected
222.article_body: A court has rejected a bail plea filed by self-proclaimed politician Shrikant Tyagi, who is accused of molesting and abusing a woman in Noida. He was arrested from Meerut on Tuesday after absconding for days. Tyagi's lawyer Sushil Bhati said they will now approach the sessions court to contest this judgment.

223.title: US Justice dept to sue Google next month over ad market domination: Report
223.article_body: The US Department of Justice (DOJ) is preparing to sue Google as soon as next month over the firm's alleged illegal domination of the digital advertising market, Bloomberg reported. Lawyers of DOJ's antitrust division are reportedly questioning publishers in another round of interviews to refresh facts. DOJ's previous lawsuit against Google alleged that it dominates the online search market.

224.title: ED, CBI can set up offices at my residence if it brings peace: Tejashwi
224.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav said he was far from being afraid of ED and CBI and was ready to let them set up offices at his residence if this brought peace. "If even this doesn't bring "shanti" (peace), I cannot help," Tejashwi said. He claimed he did not fear these agencies even during his first tenure as deputy CM.

225.title: 2 govt officials caught red-handed while accepting bribes in Assam
225.article_body: Police on Thursday said two government officials were caught red-handed while allegedly accepting bribes in Assam. Gopinath Das, working in the office of sub-registrar in Tamulpur, was caught while accepting bribe money, Anti-corruption and Vigilance director said. In the second incident, Lohit Phukan, working in the office of Inspector of Excise in Bokakhat, was apprehended with money, he added.

226.title: Suspected Maoists abduct, kill villager in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur
226.article_body: Suspected Maoists abducted and killed a villager in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district, police said on Thursday, adding the reason behind the murder was yet to be ascertained. Security personnel on Thursday recovered the body of the deceased villager, Gopiram Madkam, near his village Kahurgaon, a senior official said. Madkam was abducted from his village on August 8, the official added.

227.title: Man, wife kill 4 relatives over property in Howrah: Police
227.article_body: A man and his wife allegedly killed four of their family members over a property dispute in Howrah, West Bengal, police said on Thursday. While accused Debraj Ghosh is on the run, his wife Pallavi Ghosh was arrested. The accused allegedly stabbed Debraj's mother, his brother, sister-in-law and niece on Wednesday night, officials said.

228.title: Tyre of Coast Guard's Dornier aircraft bursts at Goa airport
228.article_body: A tyre of an Indian Coast Guard Dornier aircraft has burst during routine tests on a runway at the Dabolim airport in Goa, an official said. The incident delayed several flights operating from the airport since afternoon. The Coast Guard functions from the INS Hansa naval base, which is also home to the Dabolim civilian airport.

229.title: Will beat him, set venue on fire: BJP MLA on Munawar's Hyd show
229.article_body:
After stand-up comedian Munawar Faruqui announced that he'll hold a show in Hyderabad,
BJP MLA T Raja Singh threatened to cancel the programme. In a video message, Singh said, "Wherever the programme is held, we shall beat him up...We shall set [the venue] on fire." He added, "We shall...teach him a lesson for abusing...Lord Ram if he comes to Telangana."

230.title: Influencer, who smoked inside flight, booked for drinking liquor in the middle of road
230.article_body: A case has been registered against social media influencer Bobby Kataria at Dehradun's Cantt police station for allegedly consuming liquor in the middle of a road in Uttarakhand. While sharing the video on Instagram, he had written, "It's time to enjoy on the roads." Earlier, a video of the influencer smoking inside a SpiceJet flight had gone viral.

231.title: Arjun Tendulkar to leave Mumbai, likely to play for Goa: Reports
231.article_body: Sachin Tendulkar's son Arjun Tendulkar will likely represent Goa in the upcoming domestic season, reports said. Arjun has applied for a No Objection Certificate from Mumbai Cricket Association. "Getting maximum game time...is important for him at this juncture of his career. We believe...the shift will improve...probability of him featuring in more competitive matches," SRT Sports Management said.

232.title: UP woman kills husband, buries body in house after quarrel: Police
232.article_body: A woman allegedly killed her husband and buried his body in their house after a quarrel in Uttar Pradesh's Khamaria on Sunday, police said. However, the woman told the police that her husband, Govind, hanged himself following the quarrel. She claimed that she got scared after Govind's death and dug a pit in their house and buried the body there.

233.title: No-confidence motion against Himachal govt defeated by voice vote
233.article_body: A no-confidence motion moved by Congress and CPI-M against the BJP government in Himachal Pradesh was defeated by a voice vote in the Assembly on Thursday. The Opposition MLAs walked out of the Assembly during Chief Minister Jai Ram Thakur's reply. They criticised the government over several issues, including law and order, unemployment and price rise.

234.title: Salman Khan spends a day with Indian Navy sailors, pics surface
234.article_body: Actor Salman Khan on Thursday spent his day with sailors of the Indian Navy onboard INS Visakhapatnam. The pictures of the actor have gone viral on social media platforms. In the photos, he is seen interacting, working out and dancing with the sailors. Salman is currently shooting in Hyderabad for his upcoming film 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali'.

235.title: It hurts: Raqesh on hate against Ridhi after split with Shamita
235.article_body: Actor Raqesh Bapat said it 'hurts' to think about the hate his ex-wife Ridhi Dogra is receiving after his breakup with Shamita Shetty. Fans blamed Ridhi for Raqesh-Shamita's split. "She has been getting the crap from the audience for no reason. When there's no truth to the fact," he said. He added a third person can never break a relationship.

236.title: Gurugram makes background checks must for bouncers after guests beaten up outside club
236.article_body: Gurugram Police Commissioner Kala Ramachandran on Thursday made police verification and background checks mandatory for all the security staff working in bars and clubs. This comes a day after bouncers at a club beat up some men for opposing the alleged molestation of their female friend. Action will be taken against those agencies that don't get verification checks done.

237.title: 4 transport 30 kg of ganja from AP to Hyd, arrested
237.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Thursday arrested four persons of an inter-state gang and seized 30 kgs of ganja. The police arrested four of the seven-member gang and seized an auto and four mobile phones from them, all worth ₹9 lakh. One of the accused (Krishanaveni), has been peddling ganja for around four years, Rachakonda Police said.

238.title: Help us bring back body or get us visa: Brother of Indian woman who died by suicide in US
238.article_body: The family of Mandeep Kaur, who died by suicide in US allegedly over domestic abuse, is seeking help from government to enable them to either bring her body to India or arrange visa to perform last rites. However, as per the family, they haven't received any response from officials. "We...don't know what will happen with the body," said Mandeep's brother.

239.title: Four more held for attempting to kill TRS MLA in Hyderabad
239.article_body: The Hyderabad Police have arrested four more people for attempting to kill legislator, A Jeevan Reddy, of the Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS). The four accused - Santosh, Suguna, Surender and Sagar - aided the main accused, Paddagani Prasad Goud, in executing his plan to kill the MLA. Prasad Goud, a TRS leader, was arrested by the police on August 8.

240.title: 7 kidnap friend who won ₹1 crore in online games in K'taka, arrested
240.article_body: Seven people were arrested in Karnataka for allegedly kidnapping their friend, who won over ₹1 crore in online games. The accused called the victim's father and demanded ₹1 crore as ransom, which the father refused to pay, reports said. However, the accused settled for ₹15 lakh and threatened to kill the victim if the ransom wasn't paid.

241.title: Punjab CM accepts resignation of VC who was asked by minister to lie down on dirty bed
241.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Singh Mann on Thursday accepted the resignation of Baba Farid University of Health Sciences, Faridkot, Vice-Chancellor Dr Raj Bahadur. He resigned on July 30, a day after Punjab Health Minister Chetan Singh Jauramajra forced him to lie down on a dirty bed at the university during an inspection. Dr Bahadur earlier said he felt humiliated.

242.title: Actor Vishal gets injured while shooting an action sequence: Reports
242.article_body: Actor Vishal got injured while shooting for an action sequence of his upcoming film 'Mark Antony'. As per the reports, the actor was rushed to a private hospital in Chennai. He has reportedly sustained a knee injury. The shoot of 'Mark Antony' is currently on hold. The actor will resume the shooting after his recovery.

243.title: Hyderabad on high alert ahead of Independence Day celebrations
243.article_body: Ahead of the Independence Day celebrations, a high alert has been sounded in Hyderabad after reports from the Intelligence Bureau. Following the reports, security at temples, mosques, tourist places, bus and railway stations and other crowded places has been increased. To monitor the situation, additional security forces have also been deployed at hotels and other public places in the city.

244.title: Trial of German soldier who faces Russia spy charges begins
244.article_body: A German soldier Ralph G. who allegedly shared information with Russian intelligence services has been put on trial. Ralph G. has been accused of sharing excerpts from an official government document on Germany's relationship with Russia in the wake of annexation of Crimea in 2014. According to reports, information was shared via phone calls, email and messaging service WhatsApp.

245.title: Randeep Hooda remembers Sarabjit's sister Dalbir on Raksha Bandhan
245.article_body: Remembering Dalbir Kaur on Raksha Bandhan, Randeep Hooda penned a note in which he mentioned how he is realising the significance of her rakhi. He said he is sure that her blessings are always with him. Dalbir pronounced Randeep her brother after he played the role of her late brother Sarabjit Singh in the 2016 film 'Sarbjit'.

246.title: Gujarat govt unveils drone policy, expects to create 25,000 jobs
246.article_body: The Gujarat government has unveiled a new Drone Promotion and Usage Policy for state departments and organisations, which is aimed at the promotion and use of drones for operations and delivery of services. The state government expects that this policy will create 25,000 jobs and attract investments. The policy allows different departments to use drones for various operational requirements.

247.title: Bengaluru Police files chargesheet in Rakesh Tikait ink attack case
247.article_body: Bengaluru Police has filed a 450-page chargesheet in the case of a man throwing ink on Bharatiya Kisan Union national spokesperson Rakesh Tikait at Gandhi Bhavan in the city on May 30. The chargesheet records the accounts of 20 eyewitnesses and has named 89 witnesses. It also contains details on people who were arrested, including Hindutva activist Bharath Shetty.

248.title: Lebanon court orders property seizure of MPs charged over 2020 blast
248.article_body: According to reports, a Lebanese court has ordered temporary seizure of property owned by two parliamentarians who face charges in connection with Beirut port blast of 2020 in which more than 200 people were killed. Under the order, property worth about $3 million is to be confiscated. The exact charges have not been revealed but both parliamentarians deny wrongdoing.

249.title: Nitish Kumar created storm which can challenge BJP: Shiv Sena
249.article_body: The Shiv Sena on Thursday said Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar had created a political "storm" by breaking ties with the BJP and this could challenge the BJP in the 2024 general elections. Sena's Marathi publication ‘Saamana’ also praised RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav. Kumar ended his government's alliance with the BJP in Bihar on Tuesday to form the 'Mahagathbandhan' alliance.

250.title: SoftBank looking to sell shares in FirstCry, valuing company at $4 bn: Reports
250.article_body: Japan-based SoftBank, and NewQuest Capital Partners are reportedly looking to sell shares of IPO-bound FirstCry in the secondary market. From the share-sale, the company is being valued between $3.5-$4 billion. As per a report, SoftBank which is the largest shareholder in FirstCry is planning to reduce its 29% stake to under 25% with the sale.

251.title: BJP leader's illegal structure demolished in UP after complaint
251.article_body: An alleged illegal structure belonging to BJP leader Satya Prakash Singh was demolished in Varanasi, Uttar Pradesh, by Varanasi Development Authority (VDA) on Thursday. Satya alias Akhand Singh is Varanasi BJP District Vice-President. VDA said a room had been built illegally in a housing society named Varuna Enclave in Sikraul. It was demolished after some female residents filed a complaint.

252.title: Andhra woman kills sister's daughter-in-law, reaches police with severed head
252.article_body: A woman in Andhra Pradesh's Annamayya allegedly killed her sister's 35-year-old daughter-in-law and reached the police station, which was about six kilometres away, with her severed head to surrender. Police suspect that domestic problems and property dispute led to the woman, Subbamma, killing the victim, Vasundhara. Subbamma's relatives were also allegedly involved in Vasundhara's murder.

253.title: Nitish made up his mind to quit NDA after call with Sonia Gandhi: JD(U) leader
253.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar made up his mind to quit NDA after he called Congress chief Sonia Gandhi to inquire about her health, a JD(U) leader said. "Kumar firmed up exit plan after getting Gandhi's nod for support," the JD(U) leader said, requesting anonymity. JD(U) leader VK Chaudhary said Kumar was also in touch with RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav.

254.title: What excuse will BJP give for increasing crime in Delhi: Chidambaram
254.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram criticised the Centre on Thursday over the law and order in Delhi and asked what excuses will the BJP give for the "alarmingly deteriorating" crime situation in the city. "Delhi registered 1,100 cases of rape in the 196 days of this year up to July 15. That is over 5 cases a day!" Chidambaram said.

255.title: Congress to hold 'Mehangai Chaupals', mega rally in Delhi over price rise
255.article_body: Congress has announced that it'll continue its fight against price rise by organising 'Mehangai Chaupal' meetings in all Assembly constituencies from August 17-23. A mega rally called 'Mehangai Par Halla Bol' will be held on August 28 at Delhi's Ramlila Maidan. Congress said state Congress committees will hold 'Mehangai Par Halla Bol-Chalo Dilli' events at state, district and block levels.

256.title: 3 more accused arrested in K'taka BJP youth leader's murder case
256.article_body: Three more persons accused in the murder of Karnataka BJP youth leader Praveen Nettaru were arrested early on Thursday morning, a senior police official said. "Earlier, we had arrested seven people who were part of the conspiracy," Mangaluru ADGP Alok Kumar said. Praveen Nettaru was hacked to death by bike-borne miscreants on July 26 in Dakshina Kannada district's Bellare.

257.title: 27-yr-old man dies after bike hits parked truck from behind in Surat
257.article_body: Police said that a 27-year-old man, identified as Vipul Mohan Parmar, died on the spot after his bike hit a parked truck from behind in Gujarat's Surat district on Wednesday night. Parmar was returning home after visiting his sister's house at Baben village as part of Raksha Bandhan celebrations, they added. Police have lodged a complaint against the truck owner.

258.title: Income Tax officials put 'Rahul weds Anjali' posters on 120 cars, conduct raids in Maha
258.article_body: The Income Tax officials carried out raids from August 1 to 8 in a secret manner at multiple locations linked to some business groups accused of tax evasion in Maharashtra's Jalna. The officials arrived at the locations disguised as baratis. Around 120 cars, with posters of 'Rahul weds Anjali', were used for the raids. They seized illegal assets worth crores.

259.title: Dreams of becoming PM made Nitish betray people's mandate: Ex-Bihar Dy CM
259.article_body: Former Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Tarkishore Prasad on Thursday alleged that Nitish Kumar's "dreams of becoming PM" made him "betray the mandate of the people" and join hands with the RJD. The BJP leader alleged that Kumar "went quiet" on the issue of corruption after joining the grand alliance, of which Lalu Prasad Yadav's RJD is a part.

260.title: Will closely cooperate with authorities to resolve BGMI ban: Krafton
260.article_body: Krafton will closely cooperate with authorities in India to reinstate the suspended battle royale game Battlegrounds Mobile India (BGMI), the South Korean firm's CFO Bae Dong-geun said on Thursday. "We fully respect and understand the Indian government's concern," he added. BGMI was pulled off Google Play Store and Apple App Store on July 28 following an interim government order.

261.title: 32-yr-old man steals idols of Hanuman, Durga from Mumbai temple; held
261.article_body: A 32-year-old man was arrested by the Shivaji Nagar Police for allegedly stealing idols of Hanuman and Durga from a temple in Mumbai's Govandi on August 3. The police said that the accused had escaped with two idols, adding that they were recovered after his arrest. The accused also stole a puja thali made of brass.

262.title: Binance says it is seeing surge in clients due to rising inflation
262.article_body: Binance is seeing a surge in clients due to rising inflation and a historically strong dollar that has depressed emerging market currencies, said Maximiliano Hinz, who heads Binance in Latin America. Hinz said Argentina, where annual inflation is at 90%, has emerged as one of Binance's top markets. "More people are seeking crypto...to protect themselves from inflation," Hinz said.

263.title: UN releases list of countries with highest digital currency ownership in 2021, India 7th
263.article_body: The United Nations Conference on Trade and Development has released a list of top 20 countries with highest digital currency ownership in 2021. Ukraine topped the list with 12.7%, followed by Russia (11.9%), Venezuela (10.3%), Singapore (9.4%), Kenya (8.5%) and the US (8.3%). India is seventh on the list, with 7.3% of the population owning digital currency in 2021.

264.title: Absolutely overwhelming: Actor Roshan Mathew on 'Darlings' success
264.article_body: Actor Roshan Mathew has thanked the audience for watching his latest film 'Darlings'. Calling its success "absolutely overwhelming," the actor said that all the "criticisms, debates and opinions" he has received from the audience will help him in the long run. 'Darlings' stars Alia Bhatt in the lead role.

265.title: Cisco hit by cyberattack, hacker tried to access corporate network
265.article_body: Cisco Systems said that a hacker tried to gain access to its corporate network and was preparing to encrypt files but couldn't manage to do so as it was detected and booted out. Cisco came to know of the potential compromise in May but revealed it on Wednesday after a list of stolen files was leaked on the dark web.

266.title: Oil price steadies after IEA raises 2022 demand growth outlook
266.article_body: After the International Energy Agency (IEA) raised its oil demand growth forecast for 2022 by 3,80,000 barrels per day, oil prices steadied on Thursday. Brent crude futures fell 7 cents to $97.33 a barrel, while US West Texas Intermediate crude futures eased 9 cents to $91.84. "Natural gas and electricity prices have soared to new records," the IEA said.

267.title: Pune Police arrest eatery staff for stabbing colleague to death
267.article_body: After an eatery employee, Sunil Namdeo Sarode, was found dead with stab wounds in Pune's Shirur, the Pune Rural police arrested his colleague from Maharashtra's Palghar, officials said. Investigation revealed that another eatery staff, Ananta Raghunath Kamble and Sarode had fought the previous night. "Kamble attacked Sarode with a butcher knife...and fled with the weapon," police said.

268.title: Sensex, Nifty end on strong note led by IT, realty, banking stocks
268.article_body: Benchmark indices ended on a strong note with Sensex up 515.31 points at 59,332.60 and Nifty at 17,659. Axis Bank, Bajaj Finance, HDFC, Tech Mahindra and TCS were among the major gainers on Nifty, while Tata Consumer Products, Apollo Hospitals, ITC, Hindalco Industries and NTPC slipped. Information Technology, PSU Bank, capital goods and realty stocks ended in the green.

269.title: Rahul Gandhi, Priyanka Gandhi share childhood photos on Rakshabandhan
269.article_body: Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra took to Twitter on Rakshabandhan to share their photos from the past which included their childhood photos and a photo from Priyanka's wedding ceremony. Notably, Priyanka Gandhi tested positive for COVID-19 on Wednesday and has been isolating at home.

270.title: China’s vehicle sales rise 29.7% in July as COVID-19 curbs ease
270.article_body: Auto sales in China rose by 29.7% to 2.42 million units in July from the year-ago period. This was driven by the easing of COVID-19 restrictions and government incentives. The China Association of Automobile Manufacturers' data, however, showed that sales for the first seven months were still 2% lower than the corresponding period in 2021.

271.title: Video shows DMK councillor's husband trying to attack people with machete
271.article_body: A video showing Vetrichelvan, the husband of Tamil Nadu DMK councillor Nithya, trying to attack people with a machete following an argument has surfaced online. The argument took place as Vetrichelvan hadn't returned the ₹2.60 lakh he had borrowed from Gunasekara. While arguing, Vetrichelvan suddenly reaches for the machete and attempts to attack people while chasing them.

272.title: Married daughters also entitled to compensation by insurance companies: K’taka HC
272.article_body: Married daughters are entitled to compensation by insurance companies on the loss of their parents in accidents, Karnataka High Court has held. The Supreme Court has held that married sons are also entitled to compensation in such cases, the HC said. "The very contention that married daughters of deceased are not entitled for compensation cannot be accepted," the court stated.

273.title: Johnny Depp's 1st look from his 1st film after Amber Heard trial released
273.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp's first look as King Louis XV from the upcoming film 'Jeanne du Barry' has been released. It'll be Depp's first film since he won the defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard. 'Jeanne du Barry' is directed by French filmmaker Maiwenn and its filming is said to have started at the end of July.

274.title: New equation will be formed in Bihar, wait & watch: RLJP chief
274.article_body: As Nitish Kumar took oath as Bihar CM for the eighth time, RLJP chief Pashupati Kumar Paras said a new equation will be formed in Bihar because in politics, equations are made and deteriorated. "There's a time of over three years and we have to wait and watch the situation. The Assembly polls in Bihar are in 2025," Paras added.

275.title: Country is sinking & you're talking about Bollywood: Anurag Kashyap
275.article_body: Reacting to a claim that 'Bollywood is sinking', filmmaker Anurag Kashyap said, "The country is sinking. The world is sinking and you're talking about Bollywood." He further spoke about the heat wave in Europe and the melting ice caps. "You won't see the Maldives in a while," the filmmaker said. Anurag's next directorial 'Dobaaraa' will release on August 19.

276.title: You're always worried about Kuldeep's consistency, Bishnoi more reliable: Styris
276.article_body: Ex-New Zealand all-rounder Scott Styris has said Kuldeep Yadav's consistency might be the reason for his non-selection in India's squad for the Asia Cup. "Kuldeep can fall off a cliff a little bit under pressure," he stated. Styris further said Ravi Bishnoi is "probably a little more reliable" and that's why the 21-year-old has been named in the 15-member squad.

277.title: AAP relishes in insulting athletes, soldiers: BJP's Shehzad Poonawalla
277.article_body: BJP’s Shehzad Poonawalla criticised AAP after Indian wrestler Divya Kakran shared certificate to prove she had represented Delhi at a tournament, after AAP MLA Saurabh Bharadwaj said Kakran always represented UP. "If there's one party that always relishes in insulting those who raise honour of our Tricolour, be it a 'jawan' (soldier) or a 'khiladi' (athlete), it's AAP," Poonawalla added.

278.title: Nitish-led govt's floor test to prove majority in Bihar Assembly on August 24
278.article_body: Nitish Kumar-led Bihar government's floor test to prove the majority in the state Legislative Assembly has been scheduled for August 24. This comes a day after JD(U) leader Nitish took oath as Bihar Chief Minister for the eighth time in his political career. Rashtriya Janata Dal's Tejashwi Yadav took oath as the Deputy CM of the state.

279.title: Karnataka HC puts on hold BBMP ward reservation till August 16
279.article_body: The Karnataka High Court (HC) has directed the state government and Election Commission to put on hold the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike's (BBMP) new ward reservation list for elections till August 16. The court direction came after hearing petitions that claimed flaws in the reservation list. The court on August 16 will decide whether an interim stay is required.

280.title: My 40-45 days spent on shooting are equal to 65-70 days: Akshay Kumar
280.article_body: Following recent claims that he lacks commitment after the failure of 'Samrat Prithviraj', actor Akshay Kumar said, "My 40-45 days [spent on shooting are] equivalent to 65-70 days." "I take the same time to finish...as others take...but I've divided it in the best way," added Akshay. "My eight hours are equal to 14-15 hours of any other star," he'd stated.

281.title: ED summons 8 West Bengal IPS officers in coal smuggling case
281.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned eight IPS officers of West Bengal to New Delhi for questioning in the coal smuggling case. These officers were reportedly deputed in the area where illegal coal mining and smuggling were occurring and they were aware of the racket. Earlier today, CBI arrested senior Trinamool Congress leader Anubrata Mondal in a cattle smuggling case.

282.title: Washington Sundar suffers shoulder injury ahead of Zimbabwe tour
282.article_body: India all-rounder Washington Sundar, who has been named in India's squad for Zimbabwe ODIs, injured his shoulder during Lancashire's Royal London One-Day Championship encounter against Worcestershire on Wednesday. "Sundar left the field after receiving treatment on his left shoulder following a heavy landing," Lancashire tweeted. Sundar hasn't played for India since his hand injury in IPL 2022.

283.title: Mumbai businessman cheated of ₹22 lakh in sim swapping fraud
283.article_body: A 47-year old Mumbai businessman was allegedly cheated of ₹22 lakh in a sim swapping scam, where fraudsters obtain a duplicate SIM of an individual after collecting their personal data. The businessman approached the cyber police and said his SIM card services were disconnected on August 4. After the services resumed, he found text messages for transactions worth ₹22 lakh.

284.title: Want to be professionally stable: Arjun on wedding plans with Malaika
284.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor said he wants to be "professionally a little more stable" before getting married to girlfriend Malaika Arora. He said he wants to do work that will make him happy. "Because if I'm happy, I can make my partner happy, I can live a happy life," he added. Arjun was the latest guest on 'Koffee with Karan 7'.

285.title: Every now & then Telugu industry calls for strike, it's temporary: Vijay
285.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda opened up about the ongoing halt enforced on shoots in the Telugu film industry. "We have a system of unions there, every now and then they call for a strike for a few days," he said. Vijay added that the hold is temporary and shooting will resume in a week. Vijay will next be seen in 'Liger'.

286.title: 'Mass-termind' of entertainment: Karan Johar on Puri Jagannadh
286.article_body: Director Karan Johar has called Puri Jagannadh a 'mass-termind' of entertainment. The filmmaker said Puri has a "distinctive vision". "I'm still amazed at how he knits together such larger than life storylines so effortlessly," KJo tweeted. Karan is producing Puri Jagannadh's 'Liger', which stars Vijay Deverakonda and Ananya Panday.

287.title: Sonam Kapoor rates Bhumi, Kiara & Kriti as ‘underrated’ actresses
287.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor rated Bhumi Pednekar, Kiara Advani and Kriti Sanon as the "underrated" actresses of Bollywood. Sonam shared her thoughts during the latest episode of 'Koffee with Karan 7', which is hosted by Karan Johar. She was accompanied by actor Arjun Kapoor. Sonam also called Arjun's 'Ek Villain Returns' a "thirst trap" film.

288.title: CJI asks lawyers to wear masks in courtrooms amid rising COVID cases
288.article_body: Chief Justice of India (CJI) NV Ramana on Thursday advised lawyers to wear masks in courtrooms. "Please wear a mask. The majority of our staff and colleagues are getting COVID-19. Judges are also getting it," CJI, while hearing a PIL on freebies, told the lawyers. "I tested negative for COVID-19," Solicitor General Tushar Mehta said.

289.title: Axar's exclusion surprising, he did what was asked: Parthiv on Asia Cup
289.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel said he's "surprised" about all-rounder Axar Patel not being picked in the squad for Asia Cup 2022. "He has delivered for the team whenever they wanted and did whatever was asked," added Parthiv. "Axar should've been picked as a backup for Ravindra Jadeja," he stated. India will face Pakistan in the tournament on August 28.

290.title: 3 SRK fans arrive in Mumbai, steal truck to return home; arrested
290.article_body: Three fans of Shah Rukh Khan arrived in Mumbai on Saturday to see the actor's bungalow in Bandra. After running out of money, they stole a truck in Bandra and were later arrested in Gujarat. They said they stole the truck to reach their homes, police said. One man was from Uttar Pradesh and the other two were from Haryana.

291.title: Can't beg people to play for WI: Head coach on players choosing leagues over country
291.article_body: Referring to several West Indian cricketers choosing T20 leagues over playing for their country, West Indies head coach Phil Simmons said, "It hurts. There's no other way to put it." He added, "But what can you do? I don't think that I should be begging people to play for their countries." He further remarked, "Life has changed."

292.title: China blocks India's bid at UN to sanction Pak terrorist behind Kandahar hijacking
292.article_body: China has blocked a move by India and the US to list Pakistan-based JeM leader Abdul Rauf Azhar as a global terrorist at the UN Security Council. Azhar is accused of being involved in the 1999 hijacking of an Indian Airlines aircraft in Kandahar, the 2001 attack on the Parliament and the 2016 attack on the IAF base in Pathankot.

293.title: 'Undemocratic, authoritarian': Cong leader on Lal Singh Chaddha boycott
293.article_body: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh on Thursday said that claims to boycott Aamir Khan's 'Lal Singh Chaddha' present an undemocratic and authoritarian ideology. "I believe #BoycottLalSinghChadha is trending. Why? Who is behind this? Who else but the ModiShah Troll Army! They are undemocratic, authoritarian and dictatorial. Working like a Robot," Singh tweeted.

294.title: 10 shops washed way in river after cloudburst in Himachal's Kullu; video surfaces
294.article_body: A cloudburst has been reported from the Kullu region of Himachal Pradesh on Thursday. A video showing 10 shops and vehicles being washed away in a river in Anni tehsil has surfaced online. Notably, two women were also buried alive under debris after their house collapsed in a landslide in the Kullu district on Thursday, officials said.

295.title: I was a brown face in vanilla line-up: Taylor on facing racist comments by NZ teammates
295.article_body: Ex-New Zealand batter Ross Taylor revealed in his book he was subjected to racially insensitive comments by New Zealand teammates. "Cricket in New Zealand is a pretty white sport...For much of my career I've been an anomaly...a brown face in...vanilla line-up," he said. "A teammate used to tell me 'You're half a good guy'," Taylor stated.

296.title: Rajasthan bans animal fairs after over 12,000 cattle die of lumpy skin disease
296.article_body: Rajasthan government has banned animal fairs after over 12,000 cattle deaths due to the lumpy skin disease were reported in the state. According to a report, 2,511 deaths have been reported in Sri Ganganagar followed by 1,619 in Barmer, 1,581 in Jodhpur and 1,156 in Bikaner. A total of 2,81,484 animals are reportedly affected due to the disease.

297.title: Man's relatives chop off fiancé's father's nose for calling off engagement
297.article_body: The relatives of a man in Rajasthan's Barmer allegedly chopped off the nose of his fiancé's father for breaking off their engagement. The victim, Kamal Singh Bhati, told police that he had fixed his daughter's engagement in the same family where his niece was married. However, following his niece's murder, allegedly by her in-laws, he called off his daughter's engagement.

298.title: Economy losing money, freebies distribution a 'serious issue': SC
298.article_body: The Supreme Court on Thursday observed that the promise and distribution of freebies by political parties during the poll season is "a serious issue", as the economy is losing money because of this. Chief Justice of India NV Ramana said that there's poverty in India, adding that the welfare of the people has to be balanced.

299.title: Singer Arjun Kanungo shares pics from his wedding to South African model Carla Dennis
299.article_body: Singer Arjun Kanungo took to Instagram to share pictures from his wedding to South African model Carla Dennis. "My words cannot express how much love we received and how special the day was for us," he wrote in the caption. The couple had reportedly been dating for more than seven years.

300.title: Film that started it all, turns 21 today: Farhan on 'Dil Chahta...'
300.article_body: Filmmaker-actor Farhan Akhtar took to Instagram after his film 'Dil Chahta Hai' completed 21 years of its release on Wednesday. "The film that started it all, turns 21 today...Thank you to the audiences who continue to give it so much love," he wrote. Farhan made his directorial debut with the film. It featured Aamir Khan and Akshaye Khanna.

301.title: Kohli desperately needed runs but backed India's new approach: Manjrekar
301.article_body: Former India batter Sanjay Manjrekar said Virat Kohli deserves credit for backing Team India's new aggressive approach during the recent T20Is against England despite being in desperate need of runs. "He did not care about whether he was...getting out," added Manjrekar. Discussing Team India's aggressive approach, Manjrekar stated that it comes more naturally to KL Rahul than Kohli.

302.title: Ukraine's Azov fighters to go on trial by summer end: Russia-backed official
302.article_body: Top Russia-backed official in Donetsk said on Wednesday that trial of captured Ukrainian fighters of Azov Regiment is likely to take place by the end of the summer in Mariupol. After fighting for weeks, Azov fighters surrendered to Russian forces in May. Russia's Supreme Court labeled the regiment as a terrorist organisation, clearing way for fighters to be charged formally.

303.title: Sanju behind in race for T20 WC spot, Hooda is definitely going: Aakash
303.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said Sanju Samson is "slightly behind" in the race for a spot in India's squad for the upcoming T20 WC. Aakash, however, said that all-rounder Deepak Hooda is a certain pick in the squad. "Hooda the hurricane, this boy is running ahead, this boy is not going to stop because he is definitely going," stated Aakash.

304.title: Snack centre in Pune looted over Dahi Handi contribution, 4 arrested
304.article_body: The Pune police on Thursday booked 10 persons for allegedly attacking and looting a snacks centre at Rahatani after an argument over financial contribution for the Dahi Handi festival celebration. Rahul Gupta, who runs Raj snacks and sweet centre, complained to the police stating the accused took nearly ₹10,000 from the shop. Police said they've arrested four of the accused.

305.title: 266 kg marijuana worth ₹66.5 lakh seized in Mumbai, 2 arrested
305.article_body: The Mumbai Police anti-narcotics cell (ANC) on Tuesday arrested two persons for allegedly transporting over 266 kg of marijuana worth ₹66.5 lakh. The accused were identified as Ashwin Kumar and Raju Lohar. "The team was waiting at the spot when two luxury cars were spotted...On searching, police found several bags of marijuana hidden under the seats," an ANC official said.

306.title: Tansa dam near Mumbai illuminated with Tricolour lights; video emerges
306.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has illuminated Tansa dam with Tricolour lights ahead of Independence Day. The dam, located near Mumbai, supplies drinking water to the people of the city. BMC said that the dam has been "creatively illuminated" as part of the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. The civic body also shared a video of the illuminated dam on social media.

307.title: Google opposes Facebook-backed proposal for self-regulatory body: Report
307.article_body: Google has reservations about a Facebook, Twitter-backed proposal for developing a self-regulatory body for India's social media sector, Reuters reported. An executive from Google-parent Alphabet reportedly said the company was unconvinced about the body's merits. The body would mean external reviews of decisions that could force Google to reinstate content, the executive reportedly said.

308.title: ICICI Bank briefly hits ₹6 lakh cr m-cap for 1st time; 7th Indian firm to do so
308.article_body: ICICI Bank on Thursday briefly recorded market capitalisation (m-cap) of ₹6.01 lakh crore with its shares hitting a record high of ₹866.15 on BSE. The bank has now become the seventh Indian firm to cross the ₹6-trillion-mark in m-cap. So far, Reliance Industries, Tata Consultancy Services, HDFC Bank, Infosys, Hindustan Unilever and Life Insurance Corporation have hit this achievement.

309.title: I've got used to trolls and hate comments: Priya Prakash Varrier
309.article_body: Actress Priya Prakash Varrier revealed she was a victim of trolls, memes and hate comments after a clip of her winking in the film 'Oru Adaar Love' had gone viral on social media. Speaking about dealing with it, she said, "It's...been tough for me initially but over time, I got used to trolls...hate comments and learnt to ignore unnecessary things."

310.title: Sehwag trolls Pak conspiracy theorist Zaid for mistaking Neeraj Chopra with Ashish Nehra
310.article_body: Virender Sehwag trolled Pakistani conspiracy theorist Zaid Hamid for mistaking Neeraj Chopra with Ashish Nehra. In a tweet praising Arshad Nadeem for winning gold at CWG, Zaid claimed Nadeem beat Nehra. "Chicha...Nehra is right now preparing for UK PM elections...So Chill," Sehwag wrote. "Neeraj (or as per him Nehra) participated at CWG. This is latest news!" a user tweeted.

311.title: Daughters of PMO workers tie rakhi to PM Modi, video surfaces
311.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi celebrated Rakshabandhan with the daughters of PMO workers at his residence in Delhi. In a video shared by the PMO, the young girls are seen tying rakhi to PM Modi, some are also seen seeking his blessings after touching his feet. They are the daughters of the sweepers, peons, gardeners and drivers employed at the PMO.

312.title: US regulators deny broadband subsidies to SpaceX's Starlink, LTD
312.article_body: The US Federal Communications Commission (FCC) rejected Elon Musk-run SpaceX's Starlink and LTD Broadband's applications to receive more than $2 billion in internet service subsidies through a rural fund, the FCC said on Wednesday. The FCC further said that both Starlink and LTD Broadband gave inadequate answers to questions and are not capable of complying with commission requirements.

313.title: Akshay & I have a unique tuning to deliver meaningful films: Bhumi
313.article_body: Actress Bhumi Pednekar has said that actor Akshay Kumar has been a huge part of her acting career. "We have a unique tuning to deliver some meaningful films," she said. Speaking of 'Toilet: Ek Prem Katha' and 'Raksha Bandhan', Bhumi said that both the films can be watched with the family and deliver a message.

314.title: Go Fashion plans to open 120-130 stores every year
314.article_body: Go Fashion, the owner of women’s clothing brand Go Colors, reported a profit after tax (PAT) of ₹24.4 crore for the quarter ended June. It also said that it was working on expanding the brand across geographies by adding about 120-130 stores every year. Its total revenue surged to ₹165.2 crore from ₹31 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal.

315.title: Suspected militants attack jail in DR Congo, free over 800 prisoners
315.article_body: More than 800 prisoners have escaped after armed men attacked a prison in eastern DR Congo, authorities said on Wednesday. Fighters of the Allied Democratic Forces, a group linked to the Islamic State group, are being blamed for the jailbreak. Two police officers and a civilian were killed and part of the facility was damaged by a fire during attack.

316.title: Zerodha's Kite app faces technical snag in early trade
316.article_body: Stockbroking platform Zerodha’s mobile app Kite faced a technical snag as the markets opened on Thursday morning with several users taking to social media to complain about the same even as #zerodhadown trended on Twitter. The company shared an update at 9:21 am on its website to inform that the issue with its Kite mobile app had been resolved.

317.title: Just a phase: Maha minister on Nitish forming govt with RJD-led Grand Alliance
317.article_body: Maharashtra minister and Shiv Sena rebel camp leader Deepak Kesarkar has said that JD(U)'s alliance with the RJD-led Grand Alliance is "just a phase". He added, "JD(U) leader Nitish Kumar may reconsider his decision if he feels that he has picked the wrong party. That's not unprecedented." Nitish took oath as Bihar CM for the eighth time on Wednesday.

318.title: Noida-based startup SquadStack raises $17.5 mn in Series B round
318.article_body: Sales acceleration startup SquadStack has secured $17.5 million in a series B funding round led by Bertelsmann India Investments. The funding round saw participation of existing investors Chiratae Ventures and Blume Ventures. The Noida-based startup which was established in 2017, aims to use funds to hire more employees and increase its sales experts base.

319.title: Gurugram club manager, 6 bouncers arrested for beating up guests
319.article_body: At least six bouncers and the manager of Gurugram's club Casa Danza in Udyog Vihar have been arrested, police said. This comes after the accused allegedly beat up a manager of a multinational company and his friends for opposing the alleged molestation of their female friend. An argument had broken out between the bodyguards and the men, police added.

320.title: Several Chinese cities expand fresh restrictions amid COVID outbreak
320.article_body: Several Chinese cities imposed fresh restrictions and lockdowns to contain COVID-19 outbreak. Authorities in the manufacturing hub Yiwu, home to 1.9 million people, have announced three days of "silent management" in which some residents are confined to their homes and most are banned from leaving designated areas. People can step out for COVID-19 tests, grocery shopping and hospital visits.

321.title: What a joke, I had no desire of becoming VP: Nitish Kumar
321.article_body: Refuting the claim that he wanted to become country's Vice President, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said, "You heard a man say…I wanted to be the Vice President. What a joke! It's bogus. I had no such desire." On Wednesday, BJP's Sushil Kumar Modi alleged Kumar dumped NDA as his ambition of becoming country's Vice President couldn’t be accommodated by BJP.

322.title: She'll win gold in 2024 Olympics: Telangana Sports Minister on Sreeja
322.article_body: Telangana Sports Minister V Srinivas Goud said Sreeja Akula, who alongside Sharath Kamal helped India win its first-ever table tennis mixed doubles gold at CWG, during CWG 2022, will win gold in the 2024 Paris Olympics. "We went into the mixed doubles competition without enough practice sessions because of the tight schedule," Sreeja had said after the mixed doubles gold.

323.title: Hindu family saves Muharram procession from fire near slain Kanhaiya Lal's shop in Udaipur
323.article_body: A Hindu family in Udaipur helped avoid a tragedy after a fire broke out on a 'tajiya' during Muharram procession near murdered tailor Kanhaiya Lal's shop. Ashish Chowadia, Rajkumar Solanki and their family members poured water on 'tajiya' from their balconies till the flames were doused, police said. "This incident has won everyone's heart," District Collector Tara Chand Meena said.

324.title: I would rather lose than win on a false promise: UK PM hopeful Sunak
324.article_body: UK's Prime Ministerial candidate Rishi Sunak said he'd rather lose the Tory leadership race to replace Boris Johnson than "win on a false promise". Sunak, in an interview with BBC, said he'd tell people what "they needed to hear" and stay "true" to his values. Sunak added that he's committed to helping the most vulnerable families with the cost-of-living crisis.

325.title: Civil Aviation Minister reacts after influencer seen smoking inside SpiceJet flight
325.article_body: Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia has reacted after an influencer was seen smoking inside a SpiceJet flight. "Investigating it. There will be no tolerance towards such hazardous behaviour," Scindia said. Authorities have filed a police case against the influencer named Balvinder Kataria who had travelled from Dubai to New Delhi.

326.title: Babar Azam can become no. 1 batter in Test cricket: Mahela Jayawardena
326.article_body: Ex-Sri Lanka captain Mahela Jayawardena has said Pakistan captain Babar Azam can dethrone Joe Root as the number one Test batter in the near future. "Babar has been consistent in all three formats and it shows in his rankings. He's a naturally gifted player...he's got the game to adapt as well," stated Jayawardena. Babar is currently ranked third in Tests.

327.title: Was told 'You've to do something now': Akshay on last 2 films not working
327.article_body: Discussing the failure of his last two films 'Bachchhan Paandey' and 'Samrat Prithviraj', actor Akshay Kumar said, "People came...to me and said...'You have to do something now'." Producer Aditya Chopra, who produced 'Samrat Prithviraj', had reportedly blamed the actor's lack of "commitment". Reacting to such reports, Akshay had stated, "My eight hours are equal to 14-15 hours of other stars."

328.title: Central Railway adds Vistadome coach in Pune-Secunderabad Shatabdi Express
328.article_body: Central Railway has decided to add a Vistadome coach in Pune-Secunderabad Shatabdi Express, an official said. "Passengers will enjoy Ujani backwaters and dam near Bhigwan...relish the beauty of the forest as it traverses through Ananthagiri Hills," the official added. This would be Central Railway's fifth Vistadome coach which was first introduced in 2018 on Mumbai-Madgaon Janshatabdi Express.

329.title: 42 Malian soldiers killed, 22 injured in suspected militant attack
329.article_body: Forty-two Malian soldiers were killed and 22 others were injured in an attack near Tessit town on Sunday, Mali's government said on Wednesday. "The Malian army...reacted vigorously to a complex and coordinated attack by armed terrorist groups, presumably from Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS), characterised by the use of drones, explosives, car bombs and artillery," the government added.

330.title: Nadal set to return to competitive tennis at Cincinnati Open
330.article_body: Twenty two-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal is set to return to competitive tennis at Cincinnati Open, which will begin on August 13. Nadal hasn't played since pulling out of the Wimbledon 2022 semi-final against Australia's Nick Kyrgios due to an abdominal tear. Nadal is the only one among the 'Big Three' who will participate at Cincinnati.

331.title: Kajal recreates scene from 'Baahubali' with son Neil for Rajamouli
331.article_body: Actress Kajal Aggarwal took to Instagram Stories and recreated a scene with her son Neil from SS Rajamouli's 'Baahubali'. In the picture, Kajal put Neil's feet on her head. "Rajamouli sir, this is Neil's & my dedication to you. How could we not," Kajal wrote along with the picture. Kajal and Rajamouli have previously worked together in 'Magadheera'.

332.title: Speak about darkness you've spread: Surjewala on PM's 'black magic' remark
332.article_body: Reacting to PM Narendra Modi's "black magic" remark, Congress' Randeep Singh Surjewala said, "Instead of cursing the Opposition, speak about the darkness you have spread too." Surjewala tweeted a video of PM Modi and wrote, "Dark clouds of back-breaking inflation! Dark clouds of unprecedented unemployment! Dark clouds over the sinking economy...Dark clouds hovering over stalling industries!"

333.title: Cried for the 1st time after hearing film's narration: Kareena on 'Laal...'
333.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor said she "cried" after listening to the narration of 'Laal Singh Chaddha', marking the first instance of her crying following a film's narration, in her career. "[It's] such a beautiful story," added Kareena. Actor Aamir Khan stated that he has not been able to sleep for the past one month due to stress over the film's release.

334.title: Eicher Motors shares clock 52-week high a day after Q1 results
334.article_body: A day after Eicher Motors reported a 157.5% jump in consolidated profit after tax (PAT) at ₹610.66 crore y-o-y for the quarter ended June, its shares opened over 3% up on Thursday clocking a 52-week high. The company sold 1,86,032 Royal Enfields in the quarter, which is a 52% rise from 1,22,170 motorcycles sold in the corresponding period last fiscal.

335.title: Woman dies after falling off 3rd floor in Delhi's Shakurpur; husband held
335.article_body: A 21-year-old woman died after falling off the third floor of her in-laws' house in Delhi's Shakurpur following which her husband was arrested, police said. This comes after her family raised the issue of her bad health with the in-laws which led to a quarrel, police added. The incident happened when the deceased's mother went to a police station.

336.title: Pak only care about the 2-3 games vs India, not Asia Cup: Ex-player Tauseef
336.article_body: Former Pakistan cricketer Tauseef Ahmed said Pakistan "don't really care" about the upcoming Asia Cup 2022. "We only care about those two-three games against India. It's like 'If we win these, that's it'," added Tauseef. "When something this crucial comes up, you go back to those players about whom you once said that they should leave cricket," he stated.

337.title: UP Police constable complains about food quality in public, breaks down; video surfaces
337.article_body: A video of a UP Police constable crying and complaining about the quality of the food served to the personnel is being widely shared online. In the video, constable Manoj Kumar said, "We're served such rotis after 12-hour duty...throw them to dogs, can your children have it?" Police, however, said Kumar faced disciplinary action on 15 occasions in recent years.

338.title: Singapore's GDP grows 4.4%, growth projections for 2022 downgraded
338.article_body: Singapore's gross domestic product (GDP) grew 4.4% year-on-year in the second quarter, the Ministry of Trade and Industry (MTI) said. It is lower than the 4.8% growth seen in the government's advance estimate. The government downgraded its growth projections for 2022 owing to cost pressures and global outlook risks because of the Russia-Ukraine war.

339.title: Pakistani woman's 'Should I kill my kids?' video goes viral amid rising prices
339.article_body: A Pakistani woman's video is going viral in which she is seen slamming the government after skyrocketing inflation. "What should I do, pay house rent, hefty electricity bills, purchase milk and medicines for my kids, feed my children or should I kill them?," she said in the video. "The government has almost killed the poor people," she further said.

340.title: Jagdeep Dhankhar takes oath as 14th Vice President of India
340.article_body: Former West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar took oath as the 14th Vice President on Thursday. President Droupadi Murmu administered the Oath of Office to Dhankhar at the Rashtrapati Bhavan. Dhankhar clinched 528 votes and defeated Opposition nominee Margaret Alva, who bagged 182 votes in the Vice Presidential election.

341.title: Iraqi actress to sue The Economist over her photo in story about 'fat' Arab women
341.article_body: Iraqi actress Enaas Taleb is suing The Economist newspaper for using a picture of her to illustrate an article about Arab women being "fatter" than men. Taleb said that the image was used out of context without her permission, and violated her privacy. She also claimed it had been photoshopped. Taleb added that she faced "bullying comments" on social media.

342.title: Antarctica ice shelf crumbling faster than anticipated: NASA study
342.article_body: According to a NASA study, glaciers in Antarctica are shedding icebergs more rapidly than nature can replenish. Satellite analysis shows net loss of Antarctic ice is nearly as great as net amount of ice being lost due to thinning caused by melting ice shelves. "Antarctica holds 88% of the sea level potential of all the world's ice," lead author said.

343.title: PCB just wants to please the captain, player issues don't matter: Afridi
343.article_body: Ex-Pakistan all-rounder Shahid Afridi said the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) just wants to please the captain and agree to his demands. "Issues faced by players don't matter...The formation of a players association will be very beneficial," added Afridi. Afridi stated that ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq had pushed for the formation of a players association but the PCB didn't agree to it.

344.title: Iranian who offered to pay $300,000 to kill ex-Trump adviser charged: US
344.article_body: The US has charged a member of Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) with plotting to murder ex-President Donald Trump's former National Security Adviser, John Bolton. Shahram Poursafi offered $300,000 to individuals in US to carry out the killing, the Justice Department said. Poursafi was likely seeking revenge for 2020 US airstrike that killed IRGC commander Qassem Soleimani, it added.

345.title: Result of IAF Agniveer Recruitment 2022 phase 1 exam declared
345.article_body: The Indian Air Force has released the result of Agniveer Recruitment 2022 phase 1 exam. The candidates, who took the Air Force Agniveer Recruitment examination, can check and download their results online from the official website - https://agnipathvayu.cdac.in/. The candidates can access the IAF Agniveer Vayu Result 2022  online by logging in using their email id and password.

346.title: It's not true: Tiger Shroff on reports of dating Akanksha Sharma
346.article_body: Actor Tiger Shroff has reacted to reports stating that he is dating Akanksha Sharma, who was Tiger's co-star in his music video 'Casanova'. Speaking about the reports, Tiger told ETimes, "It's not true." Akanksha also featured with Tiger in 'I am a Disco Dancer 2.0'. This comes after Tiger and actress Disha Patani reportedly parted ways.

347.title: I thought 'Here we go again, another Tendulkar': Lee on bowling to Sehwag
347.article_body: Ex-Australia pacer Brett Lee has said when he thinks of the words "cruel, swashbuckling and unpredictable", he thinks of ex-India opener Virender Sehwag. "You'd bowl that beautiful line and length thinking I've got him...[but] Sehwag would go bang...[he] looked a little bit like Sachin Tendulkar when he was batting. And I thought 'here we go again. Another Tendulkar'," recalled Lee.

348.title: Delhi makes face masks mandatory in public places, ₹500 fine for violators
348.article_body: Delhi government has made the wearing of face masks in all public places mandatory. A fine of ₹500 will be imposed on violators, as per the official order. Those travelling together in private four-wheeler vehicles will not be fined, the order states. Notably, Delhi on Wednesday reported 2,146 new COVID-19 cases and eight deaths, the highest in nearly six months.
