349.title: Economic crisis triggers violent anti-govt protests in Sierra Leone
349.article_body: People in the West African country of Sierra Leone have been protesting against rising inflation, increasing prices of basic goods, fuel shortage and other economic hardships. At least two police officers and one civilian died as anti-government protests in the capital Freetown turned violent. According to NetBlocks, Sierra Leone had only 5% of internet connectivity nationwide during protests.

350.title: Fraudsters lure couple to invest money, cheat them of ₹3 lakh in Pune
350.article_body: Fraudsters lured a couple from Pune's Dehu Road to invest money in a fake scheme and allegedly cheated them of ₹3 lakh. The accused had promised the victims returns of about ₹1 lakh every month, police added. The accused had been in touch with the complainant over the phone since April 16, 2022, police further said.

351.title: CBI arrests TMC leader Anubrata Mondal from his house in cattle smuggling scam
351.article_body: CBI on Thursday arrested Trinamool Congress (TMC) Birbhum district president Anubrata Mondal from his house in connection with the cattle smuggling scam. He was taken for a medical examination following his arrest. A CBI team on Thursday morning arrived at Mondal's residence in Bolpur. This comes after he failed to appear for questioning twice in three days.

352.title: Have grown up watching Aamir, took his films as reference points: Naga
352.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya said he has grown up watching 'Laal Singh Chaddha' co-star Aamir Khan's films. "Even before I became an actor, I...took his films as reference points for me, for my craft, to develop myself," he added. Naga stated that it was a "huge boost of confidence" for him as Aamir liked what he has added to the film.

353.title: Will have a special place in my heart: Preity on 21 yrs of 'Dil...'
353.article_body: Preity Zinta took to Instagram after her film 'Dil Chahta Hai' completed 21 years of its release on Wednesday. "A film where there was no place for a hero...heroine, just relatable characters that we could reach out...touch and laugh out aloud with," she wrote. Preity added that the 2001 film will "always have a very special place" in her heart.

354.title: Stop lowering dignity of PM's post: Rahul on PM Modi's 'black magic' remark
354.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi reacted to PM Narendra Modi’s "black magic" remark. "PM doesn’t see inflation...unemployment? PM Ji, stop lowering the dignity of the PM's post and misleading the country by talking about superstitious things like 'black magic' to hide your black deeds," Rahul tweeted. PM Modi's remark came in reference to Opposition's protest in black dresses on August 5.

355.title: Nitish Kumar not asset but liability to politics: BJP's Suvendu Adhikari
355.article_body: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari on Wednesday said that Bihar CM Nitish Kumar is not an asset but a liability to politics. "BJP has benefited from what happened in Bihar. BJP and PM Modi's image helped Nitish Kumar to form government in Bihar in 2020," Adhikari added. BJP will make a government on its own strength in Bihar, Adhikari stated.

356.title: MP tribal man killed after forest officers open fire, murder case filed
356.article_body: A 33-year-old tribal man was killed and three others were injured after forest officers allegedly opened fire at them when they were allegedly chopping wood illegally in Madhya Pradesh's Vidisha, police said. "The officials confronted the people carrying wood...they abandoned their vehicles...started pelting stones," an officer said. CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan has ordered a judicial inquiry.

357.title: Amit Shah is backstage hero, has no desire for credit: Rajnath Singh
357.article_body: Union Minister Rajnath Singh on Wednesday said it will not be an exaggeration to say that Union Home Minister Amit Shah is a "backstage hero" who has no desire for credit. "He remains in the background and does so much work for the government as well as for the party and still gets time to study so much," Singh added.

358.title: Startups should focus on growth & profitability: Infosys Co-founder
358.article_body: Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani said startups should not debate whether to chase growth or profitability, both should happen at the same time, in tandem with each other. Speaking at a startup summit hosted by Bengaluru-based firm xto10x, Nilekani advised startups to invest in its people and hire rightly. "I'm a strong believer in not spending...on customer acquisition," Nilekani added.

359.title: Only one among Karthik or Pant can play: Parthiv Patel on Asia Cup
359.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel said one among Dinesh Karthik or Rishabh Pant can be part of the lineup during Asia Cup, if Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli and KL Rahul are together included in the playing 11. Ex-Chairman of BCCI's selection committee Kris Srikkanth had earlier stated that he "doubts" whether Karthik will be picked in the lineup during Asia Cup.

360.title: Musk's lawyers seek to question Twitter team which counts bots: Reports
360.article_body: Elon Musk's legal team said Twitter must turn over names of employees who have been tasked to calculate what percentage of Twitter's users are bots and spam accounts, according to reports. Musk's lawyers reportedly asked for the names so that defence team can question them. Last month, Musk terminated $44 billion Twitter deal, saying the platform withheld information on bots.

361.title: India reports 16,299 new COVID-19 cases and 53 deaths
361.article_body: India has reported 16,299 new COVID-19 cases and 53 deaths in the last 24 hours, including four reconciled deaths in Kerala, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. India's active caseload stood at 1,25,076, while the daily positivity rate stood at 4.58%. The COVID-19 death toll in the country reached 5,26,879.

362.title: 10,000 people forced to evacuate as wildfires rage in France
362.article_body: About 10,000 people were forced to evacuate as wildfires tore through Gironde region of southwestern France on Wednesday. The fires have burned about 6,200 hectares of land so far. At present, dozens of wildfires are ablaze across the country, including at least eight major ones. France has been struggling this summer with successive heatwaves and its worst drought on record.

363.title: WB CID raids Jharkhand MLA Irfan Ansari's house, seizes ₹5 lakh in cash
363.article_body: West Bengal CID conducted a raid at Jharkhand MLA Irfan Ansari's residence at Jamtara and seized ₹5 lakh in cash. They also seized the SUV that was earlier used to bring ₹75 lakh in cash from Kolkata. WB Police on July 31 arrested Ansari and two other Congress MLAs after seizing ₹49 lakh in cash from a car.

364.title: Comedian Raju Srivastava on ventilator, critical after heart attack: Reports
364.article_body: Comedian-actor Raju Srivastava is "critical and on ventilator" at Delhi's AIIMS, news agencies ANI and PTI said quoting hospital sources. Following a heart attack on Wednesday, the 58-year-old was admitted to the hospital where he underwent angioplasty. Srivastava suffered a heart attack while working out at a gym.

365.title: Gold prices fall after US Fed officials hint at interest rate hike
365.article_body: Gold prices fell on Thursday as the dollar and Treasury yields rebounded after US Federal Reserve officials hinted at interest rate hikes despite the inflation in the US showing signs of cooling down. Spot gold declined 0.2% to $1,788.07 per ounce after touching its highest since July 5 at $1,807.79 on Wednesday, while US gold futures fell 0.5% to $1,805.10.

366.title: SAIL Q1 net profit falls 79% to ₹804 crore due to higher expenses
366.article_body: The Steel Authority of India Limited (SAIL) on Wednesday reported a 79% fall in its consolidated net profit to ₹804.50 crore in the quarter ended June as against ₹3,897.36 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal. Higher expenses by the company led to the decline as it increased to ₹23,295.23 crore as against ₹15,604.07 crore a year ago.

367.title: CWG medallist long jumper Sreeshankar finishes 6th on Diamond League debut
367.article_body: Commonwealth Games silver medallist long jumper Murali Sreeshankar finished sixth with his best jump of 7.94m on his Diamond League debut in Monaco. Sreeshankar had won the medal in Birmingham CWG with his best effort of 8.08m. Maykel Masso of Cuba won the event with an 8.35m jump while Olympic champion Miltiadis Tentoglou of Greece finished second with 8.31m.

368.title: It's hard to digest: Harmanpreet Singh on 'bitter' 0-7 loss vs Aus
368.article_body: Harmanpreet Singh, who is the vice-captain of the Indian men's hockey team, said it is "hard to digest" the team's 0-7 loss against Australia in their gold medal match at CWG 2022. "The entire team is disappointed by how we played," added Harmanpreet. Ex-Indian men's hockey team captain Viren Rasquinha earlier tweeted that the loss had left him "really heartbroken".

369.title: Don't beat around the bush: Priyanka on PM Modi's 'black magic' remark
369.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra reacted to PM Narendra Modi's "black magic" remark. "PM Narendra Modi Ji, don't beat around the bush, tell people why you looted them by increasing prices?" Priyanka tweeted. Referring to Opposition's protest in black dresses on August 5, PM Modi said those who believe in black magic will never be able to earn people's trust.

370.title: Sensex jumps 585 points, Nifty above 17,700 in opening trade
370.article_body: Benchmark indices opened in green on Thursday with Sensex and Nifty surging 585.21 points and 161.40 points, respectively. The Sensex opened at 59,402.50 points and Nifty at 17,696.20. Eicher Motors, Tech Mahindra, Wipro, ICICI Bank and Infosys were among the major Nifty gainers, while Hindalco Industries, Tata Consumer Products, Divis Labs, Apollo Hospitals and SBI Life Insurance slipped.

371.title: There was a 'lot' of pressure: CWG 2022 gold medallist Lakshya Sen
371.article_body: India's 20-year-old shuttler Lakshya Sen, who helped the nation win its 20th gold medal at CWG 2022, said, "There was a lot of pressure this time because of past results." "I knew it wasn't going to be easy...[but believed] that I could go all the way," added Lakshya. Lakshya took off his jersey in celebration after winning the gold medal.

372.title: Anyone can announce free fuel, it will prevent India from becoming self-reliant: PM Modi
372.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday inaugurated the second generation ethanol plant in Haryana, saying that anyone can announce to give free petrol and diesel but such steps take away our children's rights and prevent the country from becoming self-reliant. He also added, "Selfish announcements of freebies will increase burden on honest taxpayers and prevent investment in new technologies."

373.title: 'Who cares?': Nancy Pelosi laughs off Chinese sanctions over Taiwan visit
373.article_body: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi on Wednesday laughed off China's move to impose sanctions on her and her immediate family members over the Taiwan visit, saying, "Who cares?" She added, "That's incidental to me, of no relevance whatsoever." Pelosi also defended her trip and said, "We went there to praise Taiwan...to show our friendship, to say China cannot isolate Taiwan."

374.title: Pant seemingly responds to Urvashi's interview about 'RP', says 'Leave me alone, sister'
374.article_body: Cricketer Rishabh Pant seemingly responded to actress Urvashi Rautela's recent viral interview wherein she talked about how a person named 'RP' wanted to meet her in Delhi and how she missed his calls 16-17 times. "It’s funny how people lie in interviews just for...meagre popularity and for hitting headlines," he wrote. "Mera picha chorho...behen (Leave me alone, sister)," he added.

375.title: Nitish Kumar told Amit Shah 'not to worry' a day before breaking alliance: Sushil Modi
375.article_body: Senior BJP leader Sushil Kumar Modi on Wednesday said Union Home Minister Amit Shah had called Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar a day before he parted ways with the party and joined hands with the RJD-led Grand Alliance. Modi said Kumar had assured Shah that he had "nothing to worry about".

376.title: Absconding Kerala Congress councillor arrested in sexual assault case
376.article_body: A Congress councillor from Kerala's Kannur, who is accused in a sexual assault case and was allegedly absconding for the last two weeks, was arrested from Karnataka's Bengaluru on Tuesday night, police said. This comes after a female employee of a women's cooperative bank, reportedly controlled by the Congress party, had filed a case against him for alleged sexual assault.

377.title: I will give her a hug: Naga Chaitanya on if he meets ex-wife Samantha
377.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya, during an interview, revealed what his reaction would be if he met his ex-wife Samantha Ruth Prabhu. "I'll say hi...give her a hug," he said. This comes after Samantha, during her appearance on 'Koffee With Karan 7', had said, "If you put us both in a room, you've to hide sharp objects? Yeah. As of now, yes."

378.title: Harika shares pic after winning bronze at Chess Olympiad while being 9 months pregnant
378.article_body: Grandmaster Harika Dronavalli shared a picture of herself after winning bronze at Chess Olympiad while being nine months pregnant. "I always dreamt about being on podium...and finally made it," she wrote. She added, "It's more emotional because I made it at 9 months of pregnancy." She wrote, "No baby showers...no parties...no celebrations...I decided everything will be...after winning the medal."

379.title: I've not felt anything like that: Gulshan on insider vs outsider debate
379.article_body: Actor Gulshan Devaiah opened up about the insider versus outsider debate and said that he has not felt anything like that in the film industry. "When I started working here, I felt that this place, this town has given me a space," he added. Gulshan further said that he might be in a small space but that is his space.

380.title: Real Madrid beat Eintracht 2-0 for record-equalling 5th UEFA Super Cup win
380.article_body: Real Madrid defeated Eintracht Frankfurt 2-0 to win the UEFA Super Cup for a record-equalling fifth time. AC Milan and Barcelona also have five Super Cup wins. In the match, David Alaba opened the scoring for Madrid and Karim Benzema doubled the lead in the 65th minute. Notably, Benzema has now become the second-highest goalscorer for Real Madrid.

381.title: BJP should have made Sushil Modi Bihar CM in 2020: Nitish Kumar
381.article_body: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar said that BJP should have made Sushil Kumar Modi the CM of the state after the 2020 Assembly elections. "Had he been appointed to the post, things would not have reached this stage," he added. This comes after Nitish ended the alliance with BJP in Bihar. Notably, Modi has previously served as Bihar's Deputy CM.

382.title: Unfortunate that only few people aware of constitutional rights: Outgoing CJI
382.article_body: Outgoing CJI NV Ramana on Wednesday said that the public must know their constitutional rights and duties. "It's unfortunate that we are now celebrating 75 years of independence but still only a few selected people in the urban areas or the legal professional are aware of the constitutional rights and duties and the constitutional principles," Ramana added.

383.title: I'm a drama queen, Suhana is the softest, Shanaya is sincere: Ananya
383.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday opened up about her relationship with Suhana Khan and Shanaya Kapoor and said that they are like sisters. "The three of us are similar but we all have something very unique in each of us," she said. Ananya added, "I'm a full-on drama queen. I'm very dramatic...Suhana is the softest...most loving. Shanaya is extremely hard-working and sincere."

384.title: 3 soldiers martyred in terrorist attack at Army camp in J&K; 2 terrorists killed
384.article_body: Three Army personnel were martyred and two terrorists were killed when the terrorists attempted to infiltrate the Army camp in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri, an Army official said on Thursday. According to some reports, two more soldiers were injured in the terrorist attack. The attack comes ahead of the Independence Day celebrations.

385.title: I hate it: Suniel Shetty on calls to boycott 'Laal...', 'Raksha...'
385.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty said he "hates" the calls to boycott 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and 'Raksha Bandhan', which star Aamir Khan and Akshay Kumar respectively. "It's unfair...Let's not destroy an industry that has its own legacy of good people and people who probably at some stage make mistakes," added Suniel. "There are a lot of people feeding off us," he stated.

386.title: Engineer arrested by CBI for demanding bribe of ₹2.5 lakh in Maharashtra
386.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has arrested an engineer of Utility Powertech Ltd in Maharashtra's Solapur for allegedly demanding a bribe of ₹2.5 lakh and accepting an initial amount of ₹1 lakh from a contractor. "The accused has been...looking after the safety and accounts-related issues in the absence of a regular accountant," a release from CBI stated.

387.title: 2 in cargo theft racket held with home appliances worth ₹23 lakh in Pune
387.article_body: Pune's Kondhwa Police busted an inter-state cargo theft racket and arrested two persons with home appliances worth ₹23 lakh. This comes after various electronic home appliances loaded on a cargo container which was parked in Gokul Nagar were stolen. "Nagpur and Hyderabad Police are looking for (the accused) in almost 20 theft cases registered there," Kondhwa Police said.

388.title: Set up a body led by PM Modi, Pope to end wars around the world: Mexico President
388.article_body: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador has said he'll submit a proposal to UN for setting up a commission, comprising PM Narendra Modi, Pope Francis and UN chief. Obrador added the aim of the commission would be to present a proposal to "stop wars around the world and reach an agreement to seek a truce for at least five years".

389.title: 2 brothers held for killing ragpicker over 'bidi' in Delhi's Daryaganj
389.article_body: Delhi Police arrested two brothers, aged 21 and 19, for allegedly stabbing a ragpicker to death in a fight over 'bidi' in the Daryaganj area. The accused, who are also ragpickers, had asked the victim for a smoke, police said. The victim refused them 'bidi' and allegedly cussed at them which led to a quarrel, police further said.

390.title: Satish Shah shares pic claiming Indian flag in it is from 1942, Twitter users correct him
390.article_body: Actor Satish Shah shared a picture with an Indian flag, tweeting, "The very same TIRANGA DHWAJ my mother had got during Quit India Movement 1942." "This version of the flag was adopted in 1947...in 1942 it was the INC flag with...spinning wheel," a user wrote. "A little bit of research...would've saved you the embarrassment of being proven wrong," another commented.

391.title: 20-year-old Will Smeed smashes The Hundred's first hundred
391.article_body: Birmingham Phoenix opener Will Smeed has become the first cricketer to smash a hundred in The Hundred. The 20-year-old slammed an unbeaten 101 off 50 deliveries against Southern Brave on Wednesday. His knock included six sixes and eight fours. The previous highest score in The Hundred was 92*(40), registered by Birmingham Phoenix's Liam Livingstone against Northern Superchargers last year.

392.title: Disney overtakes Netflix as total subscribers reach 221 million
392.article_body: Walt Disney Co surpassed Netflix Inc with a total of 221 million streaming subscribers at the end of the most recent quarter. Netflix said it had 220.7 million streaming subscribers. "We continue to transform entertainment as we near our second century, with compelling new storytelling across our many platforms," said  Bob Chapek, Chief Executive Officer, The Walt Disney Company.

393.title: North Korea declares victory over COVID-19
393.article_body: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un declared victory in the battle against COVID-19 on Thursday, with the leader's sister revealing he had suffered from fever. Kim ordered a lifting of maximum anti-epidemic measures imposed in May. "North Korea must maintain a steel-strong anti-epidemic barrier and intensifying the anti-epidemic work until the end of the global health crisis," he said.

394.title: Elon Musk teases 'X.com' as a potential social media site of his own
394.article_body: Responding to a Twitter user who asked, "Have you thought about creating your own social platform? If Twitter deal doesn't come through," Elon Musk replied with a website domain - X.com. The comment came after he sold 7.92 million Tesla shares worth $6.9 billion. Musk said he sold the shares to avoid emergency sale if Twitter forces deal to close.

395.title: Life is not 'Bigg Boss': Raqesh on break-up with Shamita
395.article_body: Shamita Shetty and Raqesh Bapat opened up about why they decided to break up. While Shamita said she wanted to focus more on herself than 'ShaRa,' Raqesh said if they were in the Bigg Boss house, people would have seen why things didn't work out between them. "Life is not just the Bigg Boss house," he concluded.

396.title: Man poses as ED official, demands ₹3 cr from ex-MLA; held in Punjab
396.article_body: A man has been arrested in Punjab for allegedly demanding ₹3 crore from former MLA Navtej Singh Cheema by impersonating as an official of the Enforcement Directorate (ED). In his complaint, Cheema had alleged that the man threatened to implicate him in a money laundering case if the money was not paid. The accused has been identified as Aman Sharma.

397.title: Easebuzz gets RBI in-principle approval for aggregating payments
397.article_body: Payments platform Easebuzz has received in-principle approval from the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) for Payment Aggregator (PA) authorisation. In March 2020, the RBI issued guidelines to regulate the Payment Aggregators (PAs) and Payment Gateways (PGs) to facilitate payments in the online space. Easebuzz joins Razorpay, Stripe, Pine Labs and MSwipe that have received in-principle approval.

398.title: US Defense Secretary pledges military support to Baltics
398.article_body: US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin on Wednesday said the US wants to hold more military exercises with Latvia and other Baltic nations. Austin, who is currently on a visit to Riga, said the US may even bring additional American troops to bolster the region against any Russian threat. Austin's visit comes as Russia's invasion of Ukraine enters its sixth month.

399.title: They want more sponsorship: Gavaskar on demand to allow Indian players in foreign leagues
399.article_body: Talking about foreign ex-cricketers demanding Indian players' presence in foreign leagues, Sunil Gavaskar said, "They want their leagues to have more sponsorship." He added, "They're concerned about their cricket." He stated, "When Indian cricket looks to protect its cricket by ensuring...players stay fresh...& thus restrict...them from playing overseas...that's not acceptable to...'old powers'."

400.title: Delhi airport installing IoT devices on its vehicles
400.article_body: The Delhi International Airport Limited is installing internet-of-things (IoT) devices on vehicles it operates at Indira Gandhi International Airport to enhance safety and save fuel, according to a statement on Wednesday. The IoT devices can also track location of vehicles and schedule maintenance, it noted. The devices will help in saving 23% fuel in utility vehicles and airside operations.
